definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Here's a look at 4 bone-headed moves job hunters commonly make.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們來看一看求職者通常會犯的4種低級錯誤。

sentences.english: The best jobseekers are and don't wait.
sentences.chinese: 最好的求職者從來不坐等其成，而是主動出擊。

sentences.english: It said the vocational training plan should be implemented sooner and enterprises should be encouraged to offer skill training for its employees.
sentences.chinese: 評論說，職業培訓應進早引進給求職者提供技能培訓。

sentences.english: The job interview is good for both the interviewer and the interviewee.
sentences.chinese: 工作面試對於求職者與面試官都是有利的。

sentences.english: He looked the applicant up and down.
sentences.chinese: 他上上下下地打量那個求職者。

sentences.english: The boss has a bias against female applicants.
sentences.chinese: 老闆對女性求職者抱有偏見。

sentences.english: But many have begun to be aware of new challenges for job seekers.
sentences.chinese: 但是，很多人開始意識到求職者將要面臨的新挑戰。

sentences.english: So what's a job seeker to do?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，一個求職者應該怎麼做呢？

sentences.english: Employers and landlords are now using credit checks to filter out candidates and unsavory tenants.
sentences.chinese: 現在僱主和房東都通過信用歷史來挑選求職者與房客。

sentences.english: And with an influx of information comes an influx of confusion.
sentences.chinese: 並且隨着大量信息的湧入，求職者也非常混亂。

sentences.english: Career clubs are popping up nationwide to help out-of-work job searchers.
sentences.chinese: 職業俱樂部是在全國都有的，旨在幫助失業的求職者。

sentences.english: The assignment of candidates to types of job is, in effect, random.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，對求職者工作類型的安排完全是隨機的。

sentences.english: Her rich experience gave her an advantage over other applicants for the job.
sentences.chinese: 她豐富的經驗使她比其他求職者具有有利條件。

sentences.english: Most young people are not eligible for jobseeker's allowance.
sentences.chinese: 大多數年輕人都沒有資格獲得求職者的津貼。

sentences.english: You can't afford the time to train a possibly successful candidate.
sentences.chinese: 公司賠不起時間去培訓一個可能成功的求職者。

sentences.english: There are more than forty applicants for this job.
sentences.chinese: 超過四十個求職者來應徵這份工作。

definition: to be employed/to be in post/on-the-job
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
